meanings.def: the action or sport of running
examples: to go running
long-distance/cross-country running
running shoes

meanings.def: the activity of managing or operating something
examples: the day-to-day running of a business
the running costs of a car (= for example of fuel, repairs, insurance)
Mr Matengu was overseeing the smooth running of the exhibition.
She took over the running of the organization.
They are there to ensure the safe running of the event.

meanings.def: the activity of bringing something such as drugs, guns, etc. into a country secretly and illegally
examples: drug-running

meanings.def: having some/no chance of succeeding or achieving something
to set the speed at which something is done; to take the lead in doing something

idioms.def: having some/no chance of succeeding or achieving something
to set the speed at which something is done; to take the lead in doing something

meanings.def: used after a number and a noun such as ‘year’ ‘day’ or ‘time’, to say that something has happened in the same way several times, without a change
examples: She's won the championship three years running.
It was the third day running that the train had been late.
No party has won an election four times running.

meanings.def: running water is water that is flowing somewhere or water that is supplied to a building and available to be used through taps
examples: I can hear the sound of running water.
a remote cottage without electricity or running water
For years he had fought a running battle with the authorities over the land.
a running argument
His old raincoat became a running joke (= people kept laughing at it).

meanings.def: running or flowing in the way mentioned
examples: a fast-running river
They showed the free-running, slick football that has become their trademark.
The engine is now in perfect running order.

meanings.def: used to tell somebody in a rude way to go away
examples: Why didn’t you just tell him to take a running jump?
The engine is now in perfect running order.

idioms.def: used to tell somebody in a rude way to go away
examples: Why didn’t you just tell him to take a running jump?
